fields.title: Which Social Channel is Right For Your Business?
fields.heading: Which Social Channel is Right for Your Business?
fields.blog_content:
Chances are you're reading this blog post because you've decided you want to get your business setup on social media, but you don't know where to begin! A lot has changed in the world of social media over the last number of years and the number of social channels has grown tremendously alongside it. But don't feel overwhelmed just yet, I've provided some key points to consider when chosing which social channels are right for your business below. 

Your Business

It's easy to jump on the bandwagon of getting your business setup on EVERY social channel available. If your competitor is on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, LinkedIn, SnapChat and TikTok you should be too right? Think again. No you shouldn't be on every social media channel available. Before you decide which social networks are right for your company, you should consider the following: What do you want to gain from social media? Does it link in with your company's goals and objectives? Can social media help you reach those said goals and objectives? If after evaluating the above questions you've established that there is a real business need to get on social media - great! Now it's time to think about your target audience.

Target Audience

One important question to ask yourself is where does your target audience live online? Which social media channel will help you to reach them best? For example, if a local restaurant's clientelle is predominantly college students, chances are their target audience is more active on Instagram and TikTok as opposed to LinkedIn and will seek information about your company's product offering there.

Social Channels

So now you've established that your business can benefit from social media and where your target audience live online. With that in mind, select a social channel which ticks both of those boxes with an emphasis on a channel which helps you to showcase your company best. There may be more than one channel and that's fine. But make sure you if you're going to use more than one, that you dedicate the time neccessary to setting it up and keeping it up-to-date. There's nothing worse than stumbling across a company's social media channel which hasn't been updated in months!

fields.title: 3 Benefits of a Website for Small Businesses
fields.heading: 3 Benefits of a Website for Small Businesses
fields.blog_content:
It has never been more important for businesses to have a strong online presence. So if your small business isn't already online and you're contemplating whether or not it's worth the hassle... check out three benefits of having a website for your company below:

1. Look professional

In an era of digital, it's almost expected that a company, at a minimum, has a website. If your customers are searching for your company on the internet and are hit with a brick wall, this may cause feelings of uncertainty around how professional or legit your business is. A website, even just a simple one, can go a long way to giving your brand a professional image online and help you to stay ahead of your competitors. 

2. Build your brand awareness

Having a website is a great way for your company to build its brand awareness. Your customers can get familiar with your brands logo, colours and style. Furthermore, the ability to create content, such as through a blog, is a great way to bring new potential customers to your site by getting found on search engines such as Google.

3. Create a new selling opportunity

If your business is traditional brick-and-mortar store, setting up a website could open up a new realm of possibilities for selling your products. For example, you could setup an e-commerce store and sell your products online also.
